snippet: The City Council approved new requirements that were expected to make buildings more sustaining during emergencies.
abstract: New York City Council approves new requirements expected to make buildings more self-sustaining during emergencies and prevent some hardships New Yorkers endured after Hurricane Sandy; new building codes will make it more possible for residents to stay in large buildings for extended periods without power; requirement applies immediately to new residential construction, while existing buildings have eight years to add designated fixtures.
lead_paragraph: The City Council approved new requirements that were expected to make buildings more sustaining during emergencies.

headline.main: New Building Codes Passed After Lessons From Hurricane Sandy
headline.print_headline: New Building Codes Passed After Lessons From Storm
